alert.note: Alert for Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 23 at 11:02PM EDT until August 24 at 1:30AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EDT WEDNESDAY FOR WEST CENTRAL OXFORD COUNTY... At 1102 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, roads, as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bethel, Lovell, Greenwood, Stoneham, Mason, and Albany. This includes the following Rec locations... Albany Mountain. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
